title: Chestnut

nouns: Fruit of the oak tree.
Fruit of the oak tree: a smooth thin-walled nut in a woody cup-shaped base
The fruit of the oak, being an oval nut growing in a woody cup or cupule.
Nut of the oaks and their close relatives
The acorn, or oak nut, is the nut of the oaks and their close relatives.
Fruit of the almond tree (Prunus dulcis).
The almond is a species of tree native to the Middle East and South Asia.
Small bushy deciduous tree native to Asia and North Africa having pretty pink blossoms and highly prized edible nuts enclosed in a hard green hull; cultivated in southern Australia and California
Species of plant, almond
A type of tree nut.
Nut of any of various walnut trees having a wrinkled two-lobed seed with a hard shell
Large deciduous tree (Juglans regia) in the Walnut Family (Juglandaceae) which produces an edible fruit with a hard shell and oil-rich seed.
A genus of trees in the family Juglandaceae, as well as the nuts growing on those types of tree
Edible seed
A hardwood tree of the genus Juglans.
A walnut is the nut of any tree of the genus Juglans, particularly the Persian or English walnut, Juglans regia.
The edible white flesh of this fruit.
Edible flesh of coconut seed.
The edible white meat of a coconut; often shredded for use in e.g. cakes and curries
Usually large hard-shelled seed
Bulbous plant having hollow leaves cultivated worldwide for its rounded edible bulb
The onion, also known as the bulb onion or common onion, is used as a vegetable and is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium.
An Indian language.
Species of plants, onion
A plant of the genus Allium used as a vegetable and spice.
A monocotyledonous plant of genus Allium allied to garlic, used as vegetable and spice.
A hazelnut is the nut of the hazel and is also known as cobnut or filbert nut according to species.
Nut of the hazel
The nut of the hazel tree.
The nut of the hazel
The nut of the common hazel (Corylus avellana); hazelnut
Vegetable oil pressed from the nuts of the common hazel (Corylus avellana).
Any of several shrubs or small trees of the genus Corylus bearing edible nuts enclosed in a leafy husk
The plant that produces the hazelnut. Botanical name: Corylus avellana.
The fruit of the hazel tree.
The chestnut group is a genus of eight or nine species of deciduous trees and shrubs in the beech family Fagaceae, native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
Any of several attractive deciduous trees yellow-brown in autumn; yield a hard wood and edible nuts in a prickly bur
Any north temperate fagaceous tree of the genus Castanea, such as Castanea sativa, which produce flowers in long catkins and nuts in a prickly bur.
A tree that bears chestnuts.
The wood of a chestnut tree.
Genus of plants
A tree that bears chestnuts; a tree of the genus Castanea

description:
The reddish-brown, acorn-shaped chestnut, tapering to a sharp tip from its light brown base on most platforms. A popular roasted snack associated with autumn and Christmas. 

May be used for other edible nuts (e.g., walnuts) or sexual slang.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's chestnut emoji is a rich, autumnal treat, depicted as a single, plump chestnut with its characteristic pointed cap, rendered in a warm, earthy brown hue.  The realistic lighting and subtle texture on Apple devices give it a natural, inviting appearance, often used to evoke feelings of fall, cozy gatherings, or as a delightful culinary reference.
